categories.name: Cafes
categories.description: Places to sit and work over coffee or tea.

categories.name: Other
categories.description: Misc bucket of other interesting places.

places.name: Bite Kitchen
places.description: Quality New American food with an unpretentious vibe. Delicious brunch at reasonable prices. Next door to The Empty Bottle.

places.name: Tarboush
places.description: Amazing mediterranean food at low prices. Wraps include tasty pickles. Amazing fries!

places.name: Rangoli
places.description: Indian restaurant with spicy curries. Madras Lamb Curry is delicious and hard to find elsewhere in Chicago.

places.name: Le Bouchon
places.description: Bustling French bistro with classic dishes. Choose any three courses on Tuesdays for $29.

places.name: Reckless Records
places.description: Storied record shop stocking large selection of music. Supposedly the reference point for John Cusack's record shop in High Fidelity.

places.name: Myopic Books
places.description: Multi-level used bookstore with diverse selection and nice seating area on the second floor.

places.name: The Ark
places.description: Small thrift store with surprising selection of designer items. Frequent sales and daily deals.

places.name: Filter
places.description: Large coffeeshop serving all-day food. Plenty of couches and tables.

places.name: Wormhole
places.description: Always busy cafe for coffee snobs. Has a Delorean.

places.name: Bru
places.description: Coffeeshop plus coworking space. Serves crepes and smoothies.

places.name: Caffe Streets
places.description: Chic European-style coffeeshop. Sleek interior, no food.

places.name: The Empty Bottle
places.description: Boasts "music friendly dancing." Good place to catch local bands as well as Pitchfork's favored band of the day.

places.name: The Hideout
places.description: Small venue hidden behind warehouses on Goose Island.

places.name: Smart Bar
places.description: Nightclub with long history of supporting Chicago's house scene. Somewhat out of place next to Wrigleyville's sports bars.

places.name: The 606
places.description: Chicago's own high line, spanning roughly 3 miles. Tons of dog parks along the way!

places.name: The Flatiron Building
places.description: Artist studios open to the public every first Friday. Many have dogs!
